intro: Gilia pedunculata var. minima, commonly known as the small-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple. Its slender stems and clustered inflorescences are characteristic of the species. It is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
